components.Name: TESM Camera Port Em FW
components.Description: This is the motorized Emission Filter Wheel available on TESM.

components.Name: TESM Halogen lamp
components.Description: This is the transmitted light source mounted on TESM.

components.Name: µManager
components.Developer: Mark Tsuchida, Nico Stuurman, Ron Vale

components.Name: Custom made environmental chamber
components.Description: This is a custom made environmental chamber that was built by the University of Massachusetts Medical School machine shop.
components.Manufacturer: University of Massachusetts Medical School Machine Shop

components.Name: 60X PlanApo
components.Description: This is the most common objective used on TESM for non-TIRF experiments.

components.Name: 60X ApoN TIRF
components.SpecsFile: Order number appears to have been: 1-U2B617; Exact item was discontinued; https://www.olympus-lifescience.com/en/objectives/tirf/60xotirf/ (https://microscopecentral.com/products/olympus-apo-n-60x-oil-tirf-microscope-objective)
components.Description: This is the workhorse TIRF objective for TESM. It has two different Correction Collars, the first for Cover Glass (0.13 - 0.19mm) and the second for Temperature (23 & 37 deg).

components.Name: 40X UPlanApo
components.Description: This objective has a UPLanApo correction.

components.Name: 20x UPlanFl
components.Description: The correction for this objective is UPlan Fl; Semiapochromat (FL)

components.Name: 100x Nikon Objective
components.Description: The information entered here are tentative. Need to be verified.

components.Name: TESM Gliding Holder
components.Description: This sample holder is a gliding doughnut shaped metal piece, which is attached to the microscope stage using a thin layer of vacuum grease (inert grease with low volatility), and is moved manually.

components.Name: Epi Lens1
components.Model: Achromatic Doublet Lens, Visible, 38.1 mm, 200 mm EFL, 430-700 nm
components.SpecsFile: https://www.newport.com/p/PAC077AR.14; The current lens has 150 mm EFL so there is a discrepancy with the specs listed here. HAS TO BE INVESTIGATED FURTHER

components.Name: Epi Lens2
components.Model: Achromatic Doublet Lens, Visible, 25.4 mm, 100 mm EFL, 430-700 nm
components.Description: Achromatic Doublet Lens, Visible, 25.4 mm, 100 mm EFL, 430-700 nm. Made of N-BK7/N-SF5 N-glass.

components.Name: TIRF Lens1
components.Model: Achromatic Doublet Lens, Visible, 38.1 mm, 100 mm EFL, 430-700 nm
components.Description: Achromatic Doublet Lens, Visible, 38.1 mm, 100 mm EFL, 430-700 nm. Made of N-BaF10/N-SF10 N-glass.

components.Name: TIRF Optical fiber
components.Description: This is a 2 m long,  Polarization-Maintaining (PM) Fiber with FC/PC to FC/APC connectors. The PANDA-type stress rods inserted in the cable ensures PM operation. NOTE: Transmittance was calculated from the Attenuation value of provided by the Manufactuer.

components.Name: TESM Magnification changer
components.Description: This is the built-in magnification changer that ships with the Olympus IX71 microscope.

components.Name: TESM Cube1
components.Description: This is Filter Cube nr. 1 mounted  on TESM. It holds a triple pass Filter Set used for Green, Red and Far Red emission.

components.Name: TESM Cube 3
components.Description: This is Filter Cube nr. 3 mounted  on TESM. It holds a dual pass Filter Set used for Green, and Red emission.

components.Name: TESM Cube 5
components.Model: Laser Quad Band Set for TIRF applications
components.Description: This is Filter Cube nr. 5 mounted  on TESM. It holds Chroma Filter Set #TRF89902-EM - ET - 405/488/561/647nm in which the ET filter was removed.

components.Name: TESM Cube 6
components.Model: Laser Dual Band Set for TIRF applications
components.Description: This is Filter Cube nr. 6 mounted  on TESM. It holds a dual pass Olympus Filter Set #TRF59904 used for Green, and Red emission.

components.Name: TESM Stage plate
components.Description: This is a rigid metal, un-movable stage.

components.Name: TIRF Aperture
components.OpticsHolderPosition: This Field Stop Aperture is placed in the TIRF light path at the back of the microscope stand.

components.Name: TESM Motorized FC turret
components.Description: It has to be clarified whether this is a FilterCube turret or rather a Sutter Lambda 10-2 dual-filter wheel.

components.Name: Andor EMCCD
components.SpecsFile: https://www.biovis.com/resources/ccd/L885SS.pdf; NOTE: the Maximal Frame Rate depends on whether or not the Camera is used at full resolution (31.4 fps) or at 2x2 binning (60.5 fps). The Read Noise level depends upon the Read Out Rate (25e- @35MHz; 22e- @27MHz; 12e- @13MHz) and upon whether EM Gain is utilized (<1 e-). The Dark Current depends upon the sensor temperature (0.028 e-/pix/sec @ -70°C; 0.012 @ -85°C; 0.005 @ -95°C).
components.Description: The Camera can be used in different modes. Reported are typical values used in the laboratory.

components.Name: TESM Microscope Tube
components.Description: This is the built-in microscope tube that ships with the Olympus IX71 microscope.

components.Name: Cube3 Dich
components.Description: This is a dual pass dichroic used for Green, and Red emission. The Red band is Longpass

components.Name: Cube5 Dich
components.Description: This is a laser specific quadruple band-pass dichroic for Blue, Green, Red and FarRed emission used for TIRF applications.

components.Name: Cube6 Dich
components.Model: Laser dual band dichroic for TIRF applications
components.Description: This is a laser specific dual band dichroic for TIRF applications

components.Name: Cube1 Dich
components.Description: This is a triple pass dichroic used for Green, Red, FarRed emission. The FarRed emission band is longpass

components.Name: Epi BE lens
components.Description: This Beam Expander Lens is placed in the epifluorescence illumination path. Wavelength Range: 450–750 nm. Transmission: >95%.

components.Name: TESM Condenser
components.Description: This is an Universal Condenser with an 8-position turret to be used with the Olympus IX71 microscope.

components.Name: Empty
components.Description: The excitation filter slot in TESM Cube 1 is empty.

components.Name: Dichroic 3
components.Model: LONG WAVE PASS DICHROIC Reflecting 560, Transmitting 660
components.SpecsFile: Custom made. https://www.cvilaseroptics.com/media/wysiwyg/cms-pages/pdf/7-Beamsplitters.pdf/ Optical table in individual holder.
components.Description: NOTE: Very sensitive to incidence angle because of polarization. It has to be 45°. This dichroic reflects the 561 laser beam while transmitting the 660 laser beam. It works in combination with Dichroic 2 and 3 to combine all laser output beams into a single combined light path..

components.Name: Dichroic 2
components.Model: LONG WAVE PASS DICHROIC Reflecting 488, Transmitting 561 and 660
components.SpecsFile: Custom made. https://www.cvilaseroptics.com/media/wysiwyg/cms-pages/pdf/7-Beamsplitters.pdf/ Optical table in individual holder.
components.Description: NOTE: Very sensitive to incidence angle because of polarization. It has to be 45°. This dichroic reflects the 491 laser beam while transmitting the 561 and 660 laser beams. It works in combination with Dichroic 1 and 3 to combine all laser output beams into a single combined light path..

components.Name: Dichroic 1
components.SpecsFile: NA; the spectral characteristics inserted are indicative and have to be verified.
components.Description: This dichroic reflects the 405 laser beam while transmitting the 491, 561 and 660 laser beam. It works in combination with Dichroic 1 and 2 to combine all laser output beams into a single combined light path..

components.Name: 50/50 Epi vs. TIRF BS
components.SpecsFile: NA; the transmittance and reflectance values inserted are indicative.
components.Description: This 50/50 beam splitter is used to split the combined illumination output of all lasers between the Epifluorescence and the TIRF illumination paths.

components.Name: 50/50 BS for combining Epi+TIRF
components.SpecsFile: NA; the transmittance and reflectance values inserted are indicative.
components.Description: This 50/50 beam splitter is used to combine the Epi and TIRF beams and direct them into lower illumination port of the Olympus IX71 microscope stand.

components.Name: Condenser Dry Top Lens
components.Description: This is a Top Lens mounted on the Olympus Universal Condenser.

components.Name: TESM 405 laser
components.LotNumber: ***Discrepancy with information from OWNER MANUAL TO BE CLARIFIED --> Output Power (mW): 150 / 365 vs. Information encoded in Catalog Number: 0100, which signified 100mW
components.Description: This is a Modulated Laser Diode (MLD) violet laser used to excite dyes such as DAPI. ****Discrepancy with information from OWNER MANUAL TO BE CLARIFIED --> Spectral Bandwidth (FWHM): < 1.2 vs. Center wavelength (nm): 405+/-5. WHAT IS THE DIFFERENCE?

components.Name: TESM 491 laser
components.Model: Calypso 100 mW [03-03 Continuous Wave (CW) Diode-Pumped Solid-State (DPSS)]
components.Description: This is a Continuous Wave (CW) Diode-Pumped Solid-State (DPSS) blue laser used to excite dyes such as AlexaFluor 488. The different nominal Maximum Illumination Power output reported by the Manufacturers are specified as individual IlluminationWavelengthRanges modules.

components.Name: TESM 561 laser
components.Model: Jive 100 mW [03-03 Continuous Wave (CW) Diode-Pumped Solid-State (DPSS)]
components.Description: This is a Continuous Wave (CW) Diode-Pumped Solid-State (DPSS) green laser used to excite dyes such as AlexaFluor 561. The different nominal Maximum Illumination Power output reported by the Manufacturers are specified as individual IlluminationWavelengthRanges modules.

components.Name: TESM 660 laser
components.Description: This is a modulated red laser used to excite dyes such as AlexaFluor 660. It has variable output power and uses a "standard" (according to manufacturer) modulation mechanism with 10kHz on/off rate. The beam shape is circular.

components.Name: Cube1 Em
components.Description: This is laser specific, magnetron sputtered triple pass emission filter used for Green, Red and Far Red emission.

components.Name: Cube3 Em
components.Description: This is laser specific, magnetron sputtered triple pass emission filter used for Green, and Red emission.

components.Name: Cube5 Em
components.Description: This is laser specific, magnetron sputtered quadruple pass emission filter used for Blue, Green, Red and Far Red emission.

components.Name: Cube6 Em
components.Model: Laser dual band emission filter for TIRF applications
components.Description: This is laser specific, magnetron sputtered dual pass emission filter used for Green, and Red emission. This filter is designed for TIRF applications.

components.Name: Camera FW Pos1
components.Description: This is bandpass emission filter present for Green emission positioned in Position 1 of the TESM Emission Filter Wheel positioned in front of the Camera.

components.Name: Camera FW Pos3
components.Description: This is a bandpass Emission filter for Far Red emission positioned in Position 3 of the TESM Emission Filter Wheel positioned in front of the Camera.

components.Name: Camera FW Pos 6
components.Description: This is a bandpass Emission filter for Red emission located in Position 2 of the TESM Emission Filter Wheel placed in front of the Camera.

components.Name: TESM Objective turret
components.Description: This is the objective turret that ships with Olympus IX71.

components.Name: 405 Shutter
components.Description: This shutter is positioned in the light path of the 405 laser and it controls sample excitation. It is controlled by a UniBlitz VMM-D3 Shutter Driver (https://www.uniblitz.com/products/vmm-d3-shutter-driver/) itself controlled by the Heka ITC18 device.
components.OpticsHolderPosition: This shutter is positioned in front of the 405 laser

components.Name: 491 shutter
components.Description: This shutter is positioned in the light path of the 491 laser and it controls sample excitation. It is controlled by a UniBlitz VMM-D3 Shutter Driver (https://www.uniblitz.com/products/vmm-d3-shutter-driver/) itself controlled by the Heka ITC18 device.
components.OpticsHolderPosition: This shutter is positioned in front of the 491 laser

components.Name: 561 shutter
components.Description: This shutter is positioned in the light path of the 561 laser and it controls sample excitation. It is controlled by a UniBlitz VMM-D3 Shutter Driver (https://www.uniblitz.com/products/vmm-d3-shutter-driver/) itself controlled by the Heka ITC18 device.
components.OpticsHolderPosition: This shutter is positioned in front of the 561 laser

components.Name: 660 shutter
components.Description: This shutter is positioned in the light path of the 660 laser and it controls sample excitation. It is controlled by a UniBlitz VMM-D3 Shutter Driver (https://www.uniblitz.com/products/vmm-d3-shutter-driver/) itself controlled by the Heka ITC18 device.
components.OpticsHolderPosition: This shutter is positioned in front of the 660 laser

components.Name: Epi Shutter
components.Description: This shutter is positioned in the epifluorescence illumination light path which combines the output of ALL lasers and it controls sample excitation. It is controlled by a UniBlitz VMM-D3 Shutter Driver (https://www.uniblitz.com/products/vmm-d3-shutter-driver/) itself controlled by the Heka ITC18 device.
components.OpticsHolderPosition: This shutter is positioned in the light path to control the ALL laser lines for the Epifluorescence light path

components.Name: TIRF Shutter
components.Description: This shutter is positioned in the TIRF illumination light path which combines the output of ALL lasers and it controls sample excitation. It is controlled by a UniBlitz VMM-D3 Shutter Driver (https://www.uniblitz.com/products/vmm-d3-shutter-driver/) itself controlled by the Heka ITC18 device.
components.OpticsHolderPosition: This shutter is positioned in the light path to control the ALL laser lines for the TIRF light path

components.Name: No-lens Camera tube
components.Description: This is a 1x magnification no-lens camera port tube (U-TV1X-2) combined with a C-mount camera adapter (U-CMAD3).

components.Name: Illumination Pillar
components.Description: This is the 100W tranmitter lighle illumination pillar mounted on TESM's Olympus microscope body.

components.Name: EPI/TIRF Freem Beam Coupling
components.Description: Both TIRM and Epi beam are coupled to the illumination port at the back of the Microscope Stand via a freem beam set-up.

components.Name: TESM Microscope Table
components.Model: CleanTop (Scientific Grade 783 Series)/CleantTop II/Self leveling Vibration Isolation System with Gimbal Piston Isolators
components.SpecsFile: 8ft high; 3/16" thick ferromagnetic stainless steel top plate; 1" o.c. array; https://www.techmfg.com/products/cleantopopticaltopsandsupports/performance-series-optical-tables
components.Description: This is the passive microscope table used to support TESM.

components.Name: pgFocus
components.Description: This is a focus stabilization device that was designed, developed and custom built by Karl Bellve, at the PMM Biomedical Imaging Group.

components.Name: TESM PI Piezo Stage
components.Model: Stage PHIera Z-Axis Piezo Precision Z Positioner
components.Description: This is a piezo electric stage focusing device. The open-loop resolution is 0.5 nm; The closed-loop resolution is 1nm. Typically the device is used in closed-loop mode. Max speed was calculated based on the Manufacturer reported 270 Hz ±20% max Resonant Frequency at 30 g load

components.Name: 405 Mirror
components.SpecsFile: NA; the reflectance values inserted are indicative.
components.Description: This mirror is used to combine the 405 laser output into a single combined beam.
components.OpticsHolderPosition: This mirror is held within an individual holder bound to the optical table and is positioned in the 405 laser light path

components.Name: 491 Mirror
components.Model: Dielectric Mirror, Broadband, 25.4 mm Diameter, 6 mm Thickness, BD.1 coating, 488-694 nm
components.Description: This mirror is used to redirect the 491 laser output into a single combined beam to be used for both TIRF and epifluorescence.
components.OpticsHolderPosition: This mirror is held within an individual holder bound to the optical table and is positioned in the 491 laser light path

components.Name: 561 Mirror
components.Model: Dielectric Mirror, Broadband, 25.4 mm Diameter, 6 mm Thickness, BD.1 coating, 488-694 nm
components.Description: This mirror is used to redirect the 561 laser output into a single combined beam to be used for both TIRF and epifluorescence.
components.OpticsHolderPosition: This mirror is held within an individual holder bound to the optical table and is positioned in the 561 laser light path

components.Name: 660 Mirror1
components.Model: Dielectric Mirror, Broadband, 25.4 mm Diameter, 6 mm Thickness, BD.1 coating, 488-694 nm
components.Description: This mirror is used to redirect the 660 laser output into a single combined beam to be used for both TIRF and epifluorescence.
components.OpticsHolderPosition: This mirror is held within an individual holder bound to the optical table and is positioned in the 660 laser light path

components.Name: 660 Mirror2
components.Model: Dielectric Mirror, Broadband, 25.4 mm Diameter, 6 mm Thickness, BD.1 coating, 488-694 nm
components.Description: This mirror is used to redirect the 660 laser output into a single combined beam to be used for both TIRF and epifluorescence.
components.OpticsHolderPosition: This mirror is held within an individual holder bound to the optical table and is positioned in the 660 laser light path

components.Name: Epi Mirror1
components.Model: Dielectric Mirror, Broadband, 25.4 mm Diameter, 6 mm Thickness, BD.1 coating, 488-694 nm
components.Description: This mirror is used to redirect the 660 laser output into a single combined beam to be used for both TIRF and epifluorescence.
components.OpticsHolderPosition: This mirror is held within an individual holder bound to the optical table and is positioned in the Epifluorescence laser light path

components.Name: Epi Mirror2
components.Model: Dielectric Mirror, Broadband, 50.8 mm Diameter, 12.7 mm Thickness, BD.1 coating, 488-694 nm
components.Description: This mirror is used to direct the Epifluorescence light path towards the back of the microscope stand.
components.OpticsHolderPosition: This mirror is held within an individual holder bound to the optical table and is positioned in the Epifluorescence light path

components.Name: Epi Mirror3
components.Model: Elliptical Mirror, Silver, Borofloat, 33 mm x 46.7 mm, λ/10, 480-20,000 nm
components.Description: This is an elliptical mirror that works with Epi Mirror4 to raise the light beam and allow it to reach the illumination port at the back the of the microscope stand.
components.SubstrateType: Optical glass with Protected Silver Coating (Code ER.2) and 480-20000 nm wavelength range
components.OpticsHolderPosition: Held in place by Newport 670-RCB Top Beam Steering Accessory (https://www.newport.com/p/670-RCB)

components.Name: Epi Mirror4
components.Model: Elliptical Mirror, Silver, Borofloat, 33 mm x 46.7 mm, λ/10, 480-20,000 nm
components.Description: This is an elliptical mirror that works with Epi Mirror3 to raise the light beam and allow it to reach the illumination port at the back the of the microscope stand.
components.SubstrateType: Optical glass with Protected Silver Coating (Code ER.2) and 480-20000 nm wavelength range
components.OpticsHolderPosition: Held in place by Newport 670-RCT Top Beam Steering Accessory (https://www.newport.com/p/670-RCT)

components.Name: TESM PI-FOC
components.Description: This is a piezo electric objective focusing device equipped with Linear Variable Differential Transformer (LVDT) feedback mechanism. The open-loop resolution is 0.5 nm; The closed-loop resolution is 10nm. Typically the device is used in closed-loop mode. Max speed was calculated based on the Manufacturer reported 190 Hz ±20% max Resonant Frequency at 200 g load

components.Name: Cobolt laser controller
components.Description: µManager device adapter for Cobolt laser developed by Karl Bellve'.

components.Name: Andor camera controller
components.Developer: Nenad Amodaj (Windows) Karl Bellvé (Linux port) Jizhen Zhao, Daigang Wen, Francis McCloy (Andor contributors)
components.Description: µManager device adapter for Andor CCD and EMCCD cameras.

components.Name: Heka ITC18 controller
components.Description: µManager device adapter for Heka ITC18 developed by Karl Bellve.

components.Name: TESM Tube lens
components.Model: Achromatic Doublet Lens, Visible, 25.4 mm, 200 mm EFL, 430-700 nm
components.Description: This is a lens that was bought especially for TESM and used to replace the original Olympus tube lens. Achromatic Doublet Lens, Visible, 25.4 mm, 200 mm EFL, 430-700 nm. Made of N-BK7/N-SF5 N-glass.

MicroscopeStand.Name: TESM Microscope Stand
MicroscopeStand.Model: Custom built on the basis of IX71
MicroscopeStand.Description: This is a custom-built  TIRF Epi-fluoroscence Structured Light Microscope. It was developed by the Biomedical Imaging Group at the Program in Molecular Medicine of the University of Massachusetts Medical School; Navaroli, D. M., Bellve, K. D., Standley, C., Lifshitz, L. M., Cardia, J., Lambright, D., Leonard, D., Fogarty, K. E., & Corvera, S. (2012). Rabenosyn-5 defines the fate of the transferrin receptor following clathrin-mediated endocytosis. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America, 109(8), E471–E480. https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.1115495109
